title: Armed Forces Day, 2025
summary:
The document titled "Proclamation 10941 of May 16, 2025," issued by President Donald J. Trump, declares the third Saturday of May as Armed Forces Day. The proclamation honors the dedication and service of the United States Armed Forces, which includes the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, Coast Guard, and Space Force. It emphasizes the military's role in safeguarding liberty, supporting global stability, and participating in humanitarian missions.

The President highlights the commitment to maintaining a strong and ready military, noting a significant increase in enlistment numbers, the highest in 30 years. The proclamation calls on Americans to recognize and respect military service, encouraging citizens to display the U.S. flag and participate in local observances of the day. The document signifies the administration's dedication to military excellence and the importance of honoring those who serve.
